column4: Is there any documentation on what a /, a swap and a /home are?
/ = \Windows ?
Okay, more importantly, does Ubuntu do this by default?
I mean, will Ubuntu automatically make these partitions?
Cool. So I'm assuming that's a best practice? Have /swap, / and /home on different partitions?
Alright... wouldn't that be a problem since you can only have 4 partitions on any HD?
Oh, PRIMARY partitions, yes.
Primary partitions = OS'es go herE?
I can insta;; Ubuntu in an extended partitions?
I see, this is great stuff. I never knew a world beyond Windows.
for all that matters, you can have a single "primary" partition, and everything else in logical ones, even other OSes.
Windows in that primary partition I assume? Then I can have my D and Ubuntu in an extended->logical partition?
just make sure you leave unpartitioned space and that should do. Windows doesnt have to use only primary partitions either.
use 100mb+ your physical if you want to hibernate
so 8,1 is enough
a good idea is to split your swap in the 2 HDs, use 4,05g in one, and 4,05g in the other
